DAVID:Â  Does MRI still bear out the old legacy of itâ€™s kind of leaky long-term? JAMES:Â  Thatâ€™s been long debated. Does Ruby leak memory? My answer is no, I donâ€™t think so. I donâ€™t believe that MRI leaks memory. Hereâ€™s what happens. One, when MRI requests new memory from heap, it will not return. If at some point, you do a massive operation, [inaudible] a bunch of data and push that memory way up, that number will never go back down, even though youâ€™re not doing that big work anymore.
